name: Lydia Lunch
description:
'''Lydia Lunch''' (born '''Lydia Anne Koch'''; June 2, 1959) is an American singer, poet, writer, actress and [[empowerment|self-empowerment]] speaker. Her career began during the 1970s New York City [[no wave]] scene as the singer and guitarist of [[Teenage Jesus and the Jerks]].

Her work typically features provocative and confrontational [[noise music]] delivery and she has maintained an [[commercialism|anti-commercial]] stance, operating [[independent music|independent]]ly of [[major labels]] and distributors. The ''[[The Phoenix (newspaper)|Boston Phoenix]]'' named Lunch one of the ten most influential performers of the 1990s. ''[[Kerrang!]]'' named [[Sonic Youth]]'s "[[Death Valley '69]]" featuring Lunch one of "The 50 Most Evil Songs Ever".
